snippet: After Scotland won more powers in its rejection of independence, the burning question now is deciding how to deal with measures that concern only England.
abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron's government lays out some options for answering question of who should have say on measures that exclusively concern England; announcement is opening move in wrangle that is likely to color general election in May 2015.
lead_paragraph: After Scotland won more powers in its rejection of independence, the burning question now is deciding how to deal with measures that concern only England.

headline.main: As Election Looms, Britain Ponders ‘English Question’
headline.print_headline: As Election Looms, Britain Ponders ‘English Question’
